result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Johanneck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.

Huber with standard release conditions.
Defendant to report to Huber facility by 07:00 p.m. on 11-27-2015.
Apply 1 day sentence credit.
Court orders the firearm and any other items seized are forfeited and can be disposed by the holding agency pursuant to statute.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael J Johanneck in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  
Jury Trial Canceled.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
20 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
1 Day Credit.
Defendant to report to the Huber facility by 7:00 pm. on:  11/27/15.

Costs: $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid in full by: 02/01/16.
Alternate:  2 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - Consecutive.

Court orders the firearm and anyother items seized are forfeited and can be disposed by the holding agency pursuant to statute.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
